Can BP can be relied upon to do the right thing by themselves and fix the leak?"

Name: Airline: The 'Big Business' game
Description:
From the rules book

In Airline: The 'Big Business' Game the goal is to run your airline in the most efficient, profitable way, enabling you to make more money than your competitor's airline.  You buy, sell, and lease aircraft, plan and develop routes and detail jet aircraft in you race to the top.

This game is branded with air New Zealand - and all routes are in the pacific. The board looks like a monopoly board.

Name: Keser Triathlon Spel
Description:
A trivia game. Players roll the two dice and move along the board. The board is devided in three stages, swimming, biking and running. When a player lands on a question mark, he/she has to answer a question. Each stage has its own category of question.
The first player who arrives at the finish wins the game.

Keser is a Dutch employment agency.

Name: Het Grote Flintstones Spel
Description:
Dino, Pebbles, Bamm Bamm and Mr Slate have lost their stuff in Bedrock.
Players have to roll and move their character's to get the stuff back. Each character has lost four items. But the character's can only carry 2 items. Players have to put the items in the sheds of the other players. 
The first player with an empty shed and arrives in Bedrock, wins the game.

Name: Coins
Description:
"Coins" is an all-new web-published game! It's easy, fun, and exciting! It only takes three people with a handful of coins each to play, there's no board and practically no time limit.
The full rules are in the forum, but here's a short summary:
Three players each choose a coin from their hand and reveal it to the others. The winner is the player who either played the middle coin or the different coin. F.ex. with 5, 2 and 1, the winner is 2; with 2, 2, and 5, the winner is 5!
It's that easy! Try it out, write your thoughts in the forum and join us on facebook: 
http://www.facebook.com/home.php#!/group.php?gid=102042533181441&ref=ts

For other fun coin-games, check out Cognes:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/68480/cognes
... and Coin Clusters:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/70359/coin-clusters
Also, for a more traditional coin game that can be played in combination with these, try Spoof:
http://www.boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/18137/spoof
Another classic is Penny Football:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Penny_football

Name: Aufbruch zu den Sternen
Description:
It´s the year 2888, players are in control of megacorporations who rule the earth. They all have the goal to colonize the galaxy and for this purpose they are building huge space ships, hiring the colonists ( with soldiers, scientists, farmers and more amongst them ) buying equipment for their ships and finally take of to fight for the stars.

Each player has 3 Spaceships throughout the game wich have to be launched one after another.
Players are bidding for equipment, fuel and colonists and when they are satisfied with the outfitting of their ships they will launch them to colonize the different planets wich are laid out at the beginning of the game by players choice.
The equipment will prevent damage to your spaceships, give them more speed or even weapons to kill Aliens or enemy colonists.
Most planets have some sort of requirement in order to be colonized.
If there are Aliens present you can kill them with soldiers or send a diplomat and share the planet with them.
You can discover rare ore and receive equipment for the next ship for free and many more.
But you always have to send enough farmers to feed your colonists, unless you have the hydroponic farm equipment of course.
Spaceships are moved by different dice ( D4, D6, D8 ) but whenever you throw a 1 your spaceship gets damaged and loses either equipment or colonists.
Players earn the most points for the majority on a planet but they also earn ( less ) points for having a minority.
After every player has unloaded his last spaceship the game ends and the winner is the player with the most points.

For every player there will be 5 randomly drawn planets ( out of 22 ) on the map, so no game will ever be the same.
There are 10 different equipments and 7 different types of colonists to choose from.
The planets can be empty, have Alien inhabitants, accidic atmosphere, rare ore or they can be fertile.

Name: Amsterdams Zwerfspel
Description:
A Monopoly clone.
Players can buy or sell stocks in companies mentioned on the board.
Playes roll the dice and move along the board. When a player lands on a company owned by another player, he/she has to pay the rent.
At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins the game.

Name: Crosswalk
Description: In this Icehouse game, two players are racing their trios of pyramids in opposite directions along a five-square line.  Pedestrians line the path to block you or your opponeent.  During your turn, you roll a die and MUST use all your movement points that turn.  You can move either your own pieces or the pedestrians.  The first player to get their trio home first wins.  Crosswalk may not look deep, but it is surprisingly fun and replayable.

Name: Infiltrate
Description: Infiltrate is a quick strategic tussle.  In this Icehouse game, two players build 15-point armies, and then try to get one of their units to the enemy's home row first.  On each turn, you must move two of your pyramids.  Each type of unit has special abilities.  Smalls can only move by pushing another pyramid ahead of them.  Larges can capture smalls or other larges.  Mediums are uncapturable.  With many options for army building, and a user-defined setup placement, it never plays the same twice.

Name: Quicksand
Description: Quicksand is a deep brain-burning abstract for two players, played on a set of Martian Coasters.  On your turn, you can either place a pyramid onto the board, or use a placed pyramid to capture other pyramids by jumping over them.  After that, you MUST rotate one of the coasters, creating a volatile board that can radically swing the balance of power.  The first player to capture 15 points of opposing pyramids wins.

Name: Stack Control
Description: Stack Control is an Icehouse game of stacking shared pieces.  Each player is assigned a color, and there is at least one neutral color in play as well.  On your turn, you can stack pyramids of any color, either helping score potential points for yourself or to eliminate rival pyramids.  If all your pyramids leave play, you lose!  Otherwise, when there are no more moves, if you have more pips worth of pyramids in towers you control, you win.  Stack Control combines the shared pieces of Volcano with the scoring mechanism of IceTowers, and bears a striking similarity to Sid Sackson's Focus.

Name: Thunderstone: For the Dwarf Promo
Description:
From deep within the halls of Stonehold, the dwarven clans feel the Thunderstone's rumble… its calling power. Though opposed to interfering with the toplanders, the stoic clanmen elders know too well the trepidations of a Thunderstone falling to the darkness. As the dwarven clans join the fight, they are led by their brave sergeants, commanders, and champions, who bring impressive power while empowering others through heroic and determined leadership.

This set features a full playset of these promo cards:
x6 Clan Sergeant
x4 Clan Commander
x2 Clan Champion
x1 Clan randomizer

These promos are available through the BoardGameGeek Geek Store.

Name: Cross Number Roll
Description:
Contents 23 dice, some with numbers all the way around, some with mathematical symbols all the way around.
3 minute Egg timer
Cup

Turn the egg timer over and roll however many dice you wish.  Try to make a true mathematical equation with as many dice as possible, while rerolling whichever dice you wish.  When the timer stops, score a point for each die in the true equation.

example. "10 + 6 = 11 + 5" is worth 7 points

Name: The Tiltyard
Description:
From the Designer's own description:

"The Tiltyard is a sort of multi-round trick taking game, somewhat like a cross between the Sedma Group and a beating game. The game is themed around jousting events (the lance, the axe, and the sword) so there are three rounds with two "passes" each. One player leads a card and the other must play a higher card of the same colour, or a matching card of the opposite colour, or pass. If they play a card, then the trick continues and the other player faces the same three options. This continues until someone passes, the other player captures all of the cards played to the trick. At the start of the game, each player chooses 3 Royal Favours (court cards or Aces). These cards can be activated at the beginning of a round to impart a special ability to the owner (for instance, a Jack adds +1 to the value of all cards of its colour). They also determine which cards will be used for scoring your captured tricks: only cards of the majority colour within the 3 Royal Favours are counted."

All you need to play are the rules (PDF file) and a standard deck of cards.

Name: Whitewater
Description:
Can you make it through the rapids with a whole crew?

Place one of your rafts at the "Put In" point and try to maneuver it through the pockets to the "Take Out" point.  Your crew is represented by steel beebees, and they fall out of the bottom of the rafts if you cross over one of the pockets.
You score a point for each of your crew who make it to the other side.  Once both of your rafts are safely ashore, your opponent takes their turn.

Name: Capitan
Description:
CAPITAN is a new concept of Napoleonic simulation game, which can be played by both the neophyte and the Napoleonic “grognards”

If you do not have figures we can endeavour you to build your own small units, if you already have them congratulations (28mm, 25mm or 15mm. no problem with the scale or the basing system), you have infinite game possibilities with CAPITAN

Do not think CAPITAN is a “skirmish” game, it is a game system based on the infinity of battles during the Napoleonic wars.

The Combat

CAPITAN is a selection of rules designed to play battles between small groups of troops, such as advance recognition, convoy escort, guerrilla actions, raids on small towns, border posts, incursions into enemy territory, actions against advanced camps, and all those situations where specific tasks were assigned to a few troops of their units.

The troops

In most cases these clashes included small combination of infantry and cavalry, where the training and preparation of the troops was important, unlike the big battles where the big formation groups and the way they were formed was very important (column, line, square, etc.). The gameplay is frenetic and highly addictive.

Name: Captain Special Ops WWII
Description:
CAPTAIN SPECIAL OP’S (CSOP) Second World War game rules, that belong to the series of CAPITANGAMES CAPTAIN they are designed to play confrontations between small groups of specialized troops, such as airborne assaults, reconnaissance in enemy territory, intelligence missions, coup de main, special operations, commandos actions, patrol scouts, escorting convoys, attacks on villages, border incursions into enemy territory, armour clashes, and all those situations in which specific tasks entrusted to a few units.In most cases small combinations of infantry, armoured and support teams, are included, in what the important thing was the training and preparation of troops, in contrast to the great battles, where large groups of troops and impact of the strategy was crucial.

CSOP is a pure tactical game, the player has to know how to combine arms, infantry, armour and artillery. Our goal is “keep it simple & historically accurate”

Name: Warhammer: Invasion – March of the Damned
Description:
From the publishers website:
Savage warriors, the Lizardmen of the jungles of Lustria are vigilant in their fight to restore order to the world, but their enigmatic motivations make them uncertain and often dangerous allies. Meanwhile, the Vampire Counts, from their gods-forsaken castles and fortresses, lust after the power of the mortal races. It is this willful ambition that gives them their power over the dead, and those armies of Order that refuse to surrender to the Vampire Counts in life may come to serve them as mindless slaves in death.

March of the Damned is the next deluxe expansion for Warhammer: Invasion The Card Game, and it will bring new strategic depth to your deck-building experience when it hits store shelves this fall.

With 165 cards (3 copies each of 55 cards) consisting of new deck-building options for players of all factions, March of the Damned brings, as neutral forces, the mysterious danger of the jungle-dwelling Lizardmen and the foul dark arts of the Vampire Counts to Warhammer: Invasion. March of the Damned also introduces two new keywords, 'Savage' and 'Necromancy', bringing a new level of strategy to your game.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Warhammer Invasion – Living Card Game

Name: Convoluted
Description:
Convoluted - it sounds complicated. But it isn't.

Convoluted is a card game that can be picked up in minutes and then enjoyed for hours. Complete the word 'Convoluted' while using action cards to disrupt your opponents. Why not steal their best cards? Or just destroy anything you don't like the look of. To throw a spanner in the works take some cards from play, shuffle them and deal them back out at random.

Play as nicely as you like but if you have a mean streak it might just help you win. Play with two to four players or shuffle together multiple copies of the game to play with even more people.
